metadata.Title: CVE-2015-5523 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
The ParseValue function in lexer.c in tidy before 4.9.31 allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via vectors involvingmultiple whitespace characters before an empty href, which triggers a largememory allocation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5523` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtidy-0.99-0 - 20091223cvs-1.2ubuntu1.1
tidy - 20091223cvs-1.2ubuntu1.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: tidy package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '20091223cvs-1.2ubuntu1.1').
